alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 9:33PM EDT until June 25 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN WARRICK...SOUTHWESTERN SPENCER...DAVIESS AND EAST CENTRAL HENDERSON COUNTIES... At 833 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stanley, or 11 miles west of Owensboro, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management reported quarter size hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Owensboro, Rockport, Whitesville, Masonville, Stanley, Knottsville, St. Joseph, Eureka, Moseleyville and Hebbardsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 165 between Mile Markers 60 and 70. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 11 and 23. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
